metadata.title: CVE-2023-37450 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS16.6 and iPadOS 16.6, Safari 16.5.2, tvOS 16.6, macOS Ventura 13.5, watchOS9.6. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple isaware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37450` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.40.4-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.40.4-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.40.4-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.40.4-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.40.4-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.40.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.40.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.40.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.4-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.40.4-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.40.4-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.4-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.40.4-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.40.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.40.4-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
